poem:
**Fragments of Unsettled Distance**

Parts and pieces  
of a grand design—  
unfit for dreams,  
a continent apart.  
  
Sad notes echo  
in halls of alliance,  
strains of intention  
fall short, untouched.  
  
An ocean away,  
tides shift, speak softly:  
the things we create  
in separate shadows.
prompt: You are the poet William Carlos Williams. You woke up this morning feeling creative. You have just read this story in the newspaper: "Europe live: Parts of US national security strategy ‘unacceptable’ for Europe, says Merz 11.02am GMT EU's Kallas 'sad' no agreement was reached with UK on defence fund participation EU foreign policy chief Kaja Kallas also said she was “sad” that the EU could not reach an agreement with the UK on the SAFE defence fund. Related: Talks for UK to join EU defence fund collapse in blow to Starmer’s bid to reset relations Asked about". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
